review_text: How can the food be great anywhere. When the service first leaves a bad taste in your mouth.  First off.   Not a single Japanese person in site. Pakistani cooks. Impersonal waiters.  Super uncomfortable place to sit.   It’s difficult to rate this place. While the food is unique.  Tasty ramen.  No question.   But the service was terrible.   The only good thing about this place was the Italian French kid at the door.  Super funny. Nice guy. But that’s it.   Cool atmosphere. But super hard to relax.    Sitting at the high tops you have people running back and forth  banging into you all the time.  The cook who was dipping his fingers into everyone’s ramen  placing the eggs inside. And nori etc.  kept touching SKITS And paper and scratching his face. Then placing the food by hand in the bowls.   Not washing his hands once.  Meanwhile. The pasta boiler. Sous chef. Who didn’t touch food at all. Washed his hands like 10 times in 10 minutes.    Insane.   Also.  Well overpriced for  what you get.  This is for sure.

Food is good, waiting time is +1h after you receive the sms to go to restaurant.
Long, long, waiting time, >2.5h +1h after the SMS.
Was it good? Yes. Would I come again? No
No room to sit comfortably since under all tables are bottle crates
After 10 minutes waiters come and ask if you have finished, even if you are literally eating. So you wait +3.5h you have 10 min to eat.

A very dirty place with disgusting service, uncomfortable tables, they want to seat everyone on top of each other... UNSANITARY! Aren't you disgusted by this, administrators?! Waiters run and touch dirty decorations with their heads and faces, dust falls on people. There is a queue outside, while there were free tables inside. The service is a huge minus, one dirt... As for the food, it is more or less normal, but charging 3 euros for a hot sauce as an addition is a disgrace for the establishment.

We waited 2 hours in the line online, then came and stuff didn’t care at all. I got bad sitting at the kitchen , I asked to have another place (because it was too hot from the cooking) and I had to wait another hour. We left without eating. hope this review will change customer service. If you have so many customers and you don’t care ant new ones you will be closed soon!

The food tasted okay, rather underwhelming for a nearly 3-hours wait. Even in Japan you don’t share tables with strangers, yet you are forced to sit with strangers after an arduous wait. I started queuing with 1hr 40minutes to my turn, it is still okay if not for the fact that I turned up at the stated time on the app only to wait another 40 minutes by the door. And another 30 minutes for my food. All could be redeemed with good food, but the food is downright underwhelming. Give this a miss if you are a traveller/tourist from Asia. You can get better ramen at lower prices and much shorter waiting times at home. One would expect to be blown away after a 3-hours wait but this place failed to deliver.

Broth 7/10. Noodles 5/10. Menu options are great. Service is abhorrent. They literally will go out of their way to ignore your request to order or anything you need. Place was empty and took 20 minutes to sit and another 35 to order. Long story short , i love ramen.  I love Japan. And i love ramen in Paris. But i won’t return. Lots of great stuff on the other bank (near the other kodawari)

Sadly if needs more 1 star review to let the world know its over rated and a really bad ramen. My photo explains alot. Its basically salt water with olive oil and some sansho n a vine tomato. No one made noodle like this in japan. That the 2nd biggest mistake. Its basically a abomination of a ramen that somehow fake its review to the top of there. I visit japan 4 to 5 times a year. Eat thousands of japanese food to call this bs out

Awful experience! The staff is nice and friendly, the setting is also nice and makes you feel like you are in Japan. But the food was awful ! The chicken was smelly and the smell was so strong that we couldn’t even eat it. It left us nauseous for 2 days. It seems like that they don’t clean their chicken before cooking it because I have never had such an experience before.
Reason: high negative sentiment, low star rating, descriptive of poor food quality, lack of balance, desinformations regarding the chicken cleaning process and it matches the average suspicious factors, bert anomaly detected, and ai detection suggests generation. --------

review_text:
The ambiance is very old style and the chef is preparing ramen at the bar. It is very fast and messy and loud. The staff is helpful and service is fast.

Regarding the food. I do not know where to start. There are 11k reviews with 4.5, but if you are a true ramen fan and prefer freshly made ingredients it is definitely not the right place to go. I ordered the signature dish with the egg and chef recommendation. The meat and noodles are not fresh, the broth had a very strong artificial flavour. The egg was good but apart from that nothing else. Totally not worth the 21 euro

I do not recommend this restaurant for ramen lovers

The service was fine, the atmosphere was great. BUT the food is quite disappointing not to mention we waited for more than an hour... My first bite already made me wonder why people would want to queue so long for it. It tasted like a 2-star but just to balance it out I make it a one. Some says it only tastes salty, but I think it is not just that. I did taste different flavours in the soup BUT they just did not go well together!!

Waited for over 15 minutes to get served before giving up and walking out.

We were staring at the waiters and waving Hello at them but they didn't come. Eventually, I got fed up of waiting and started very obviously waving at them by swinging my whole arm instead of just a normal wave of the wrist.

The waiter in his 20s to 30s with white skin and a beard that greeted us was busy talking to other waiters. Even after he saw me waving at him and he finished his conversation, he decided to stand around instead.

At that point, we knew that the service would be bad so we weren't going to put up with anymore of this treatment.

The bathroom was also filthy and looked like it belonged in a whorehouse. No toilet paper and unsanitary conditions all over.
Reason: PARTIEL (0.98): excessive vivid descriptions of service failure, repetitive emphasis on waiter inaction, lack of constructive feedback typical of genuine reviews, and high suspicion score suggesting potential ai generation. Content offensive to the waiter

review_text:
Be aware this is not a ramen, it is a salty chicken broth/soup with low end ingredients, the pork and chicken are not chashu (slow cooked in spices), but some random meat (not even pork belly that should be used).

Decoration of the place is nice.

Also they are selling normal version and chefs version, waiter saying normal version is not good and that it doesn’t have anything (for 14€?). Not so common you are talking rubbish about something you are selling. We took chef’s, which is small for 19,5€.

All in all a miss, I wouldn’t recommend this place if you are looking for a real ramen.
Ramen very lacking in flavor, despite the addition of extra tare, the soup was devoid of flavor. Kimchi was not spicy, edamame was cold, only eringi mushrooms were good.

Order classic ramens. No need to do chef special for extra money. If you are claustrophobic, do not dine here! They sit strangers together on the same table. Normally restaurants in Paris should not ask customers to pay tips since the service has already been included, but this place charges 15% for no reasons. Food was okay. Smaller portion than in the states but not as salty. Below are the pictures of shoyu ramen and ramen with clear broth.

Quality in the ingredients, but too long to wait for food, especially ramen. You get so cold and hungry while you wait your turn for two and a half hours, you go somewhere else to curb your appetite, but end up ruining it because you were so hungry. And the app they have you using is not accurate. It’s says you will be next in line in 10 min then you end up waiting another 40 min. Then once you get a seat be prepared to wait another 30-40 min for your food in the restaurant. You really start to question your sanity and whether that was a complete waste of time. Not worth it even if it’s not that expensive. Also the restaurant is quite small so you are often bumped by the staff which I didn’t find pleasant or civilised whilst eating. Service…what service? The amount of people they are dealing with you just feel like another number.

Well, I recently dined at this restaurant and while the food itself was enjoyable, the overall experience left room for improvement. We had a long wait to be seated, and once we were finally at our table, the service was slow and not particularly attentive. We found ourselves waiting quite a while for our orders to be taken and even longer for the food to arrive.
Reason: review markers of ai generation, lack of user engagement and desinformation as we have a system of virtual queue so you don't need to wait in front of the restaurants, and similarity to non-genuine interaction patterns suggest a fake review. user history as a new reviewer with minimal engagement further supports this classification. ------------------------

review_text:
We got niboshi paitan ramen and kurogoma ramen. Both were very salty 😖, especially kurogoma ramen. Niboshi broth was a little fishy due to the sardines. The pork slice was quite fatty. Noodles were good though. The toppings are quite minimal 🫠 – one pork slice, a sheet of nori, and a few pieces of menma.

Expected cramped seating amidst a dark interior. Poor customer service. The servers aren’t very welcoming. We were made to wait outside for a while before being led in to our seats, but there were already several tables available?? And the server took so long to take our order even after we signalled to her. I guess it was more important to lead other patrons in, clear tables, serve food, and everything else 🙄 Their ramen may be reminiscent of Japan but their hospitality can’t compare.

I am giving two stars, only for amazing intern decorations. My food experience was pretty bad unfortunately and I feel scammed as a tourist. I was in a bit hurry so I immediately accepted waiter recommendation (my bad). I got SUPER CHEF VERSION of shio lemon what was the most expensive and literally the worst ramen I have ever eaten. The "premium" version (which I believe it's all ingredients double) totally destroyed composition, to many lemons made broth to much sauer in the end. I have eaten a much way better ramen for less than half the price (about 30 euro). Even in Paris I ate a better one for less price at place with less stars.
Reason: Desinformation as lemon shio doesnt exist in the menu.

review_text: We arrived to book a table and was told the waiting time would be 15-20 minutes. In reality it was 1 hour, not being apoligized, just facing rude treatment when asked about the waiting time. Food was great when it finally arrived after one hour of waiting. So we waited 2 hour from the arrival to get the food, faced rude service, and the apoligize we got was one small dessert for table of four. Also we were seated next to the door which they couldnt keep closed so we were freezing the whole time. If you’re hungry or want good service I can’t recommend going there.

2.7S **
It seems that being just about as far away from Japan as you can get has its consequences... I think that I have had pretty good Ramen in my time, so when I heard that a Michelin recommended Ramen shop was in Paris, I had to stop by. It was a busy day obviously, because I had to wait outside for nearly 2 hours for a seat for just myself! All this would be forgivable and even expected if the place respected my patronage while inside. Yet, they forget about my starters, give me the Ramen first, then ask me if I still want my starters after having to flag them down. Then, the cherry on top was that at no point was I offered water or given any. They put multiple water pitchers on the table, but conveniently none within my reach, so, unless I asked a stranger to pass their pitcher, no water was received. [And the space is so small, and there's only one bathroom, and it's hard to get to, aaaaaaah]
Service issues aside, I'm sorry to report that nothing was that great, let alone Michelin worthy. While the broth was good on initial hit, it failed to have a lasting impact for wanting more. The noodles were basic, and the Cashu Pork cuts were unreasonably big and long. The Tamagos didn't pop, and is it impossible to find anything in France that's actually spicy, even when advertised as such? All that's to say, I have had much better Ramens across my many stops through the Pacific North West, all with better Ramen and sides than this one. The dessert was the only bright light in that meal, and I hope for the People of Paris' sake that this place takes considerable measures to make it an experience worth waiting for.

Disappointed. Overrated.
Went on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. Queuing for almost 2 hours with high expectation. When we finally got inside, the seating was very cramped and uncomfortable, had to squeeze pass other customers while getting in and out to our seats.

Food was very disappointing. I don't think the menu was authentic as the Tsukeme is like chinese Dan Dan noodles which was overly seasoned. The gyoza we ordered was served unwrapped, which I have never tried. All the ingredients and the skin were separated?

Also I have been to quite a few ramen places it was the first place pork chashu does not come with the noodles soup but is to be ordered as extra toppings.

I left frustrated and would not come back again.

We left... We waited 10-15 minutes outside before they opened. Then 1 full hour inside after the opening. After asking twice, the waitress told us that we would have to wait another 15 minutes. We had other things planned. 1 hours and 15 minutes to eat some ramen is a very long time. We left. Too bad...we were hungry.

The one who is outside guiding the queue is definitely a racist. Everytime when people*EXCEPT ASIANS* came in for the queue, she would go up to them and let them know that they have to scan the code to make the reservation (otherwise it doesn't count whether you have waited for hours) but for a long time, I have witnessed she NEVER SAYS A SINGLE THING TO ASIAN CUSTOMERS. Is it because she just assume that asians won't speak french?? How can you be a racist when you are working for a japanese restaurant??? I would never go to a restaurant that supports racists.

3 hour wait. Not worth the wait or hype. Ramen was good, but not particularly special. They also did not have the ramen burger that is shown in the photos here. If I knew that, I would not have waited. Had essentially half mojitos since the server spilled them and still served it. Seriously not sure why we waited for this. Cramped, shared seating on tiny rocky stools with smelly walls.

We are sick, Bad experience! not as expected! waited 2 hours, In my opinion, the taste is very-very ordinary, I am a ramen lover, I have a lot of experience eating ramen, but this is just ordinary! Maybe because of what we ordered after eating Shio paitan ramen, my girlfriend went straight to the toilet feeling like vomiting and had a stomachache, I felt nauseous after eating and went home all night I vomited! and stomach problems! in my opinion it was not as expected, I was sick all night vomiting all soup and had diarrhea!

Worst dinner experience i ever had in my life!!!
At first you have to scan a QR code to join a waiting line, but the waiting time displayed is not accurate at all and changes for longer the whole time!
After we have waited for over an hour (it said 30 min at first) we got a text that we were next in line!
So we got to the restaurant and told the woman who was organising the waitingline that we arrived. After around 20 minutes we asked her how it is going (many people already went inside) and she realised that she can‘t find our name on her list and told us not to worry and just wait a little longer (no problem for us).
After another 30 minutes, when people that were cleary behind us (they got the text more than 30 minutes after us) got a table we asked her about our table again and she just told us to wait again…
After some time (10 minutes) she told us to come in and gave us a table that was supposed to be for another group. Very unfortunately it was the table right in front of the entrance door which opened every minute or less! We were really cold and asked to maybe get another table but they just said no!
So we ate our food (which was very good) and also our waiter inside the restaurant was very nice.
I also have to add that i am working as a server myself so I do have a lot of patience and understanding and I know things can get wrong. This is also the first bad review I ever wrote, but I have to say I never got that disappointed when I went out for dinner.
Reason: PARTIEL (0.99): patterns suggest artificial construction, ai generated phrases, and a narrative of inconsistent customer service indicative of suspicious review.! It's not the fault of the restaurant but the app and the review is inconsistent because she said that she like the food, the waiters were nice but she gave only one star

review_text: Server tried to add 2 drinks to my order with hopes I wouldn’t notice.  And the same server had the nerve to say “that’s all you want to leave?” for the tip AFTER he blatantly tried to scam me. Please check your ticket and/or make sure the total for your meal is correct before you pay here!! First time someone has attempted to scam me in my many years of coming to Paris.  Shame.

I saw a huge line in front of this place so I went the following day outside the peak time to try it out.

The starters were tiny but very good. The edamame and algae salad.

We had a chicken and lemon ramen and the special wagyu one. Both were very unpleasant. I am not a ramen expert but I was expecting a flavorful dish. The noodles itself was ok. But the soup was oily and lacking flavor. The wagyu one was super fatty.
This was by far the worst meal we had in Paris. I honestly do not know why people would wait that long. I wouldnt eat it for free. The atmosphere is great tgough and the servixe friendly.

I ordered the chicken ramen which is Shio Paitan Ramen, never again! This place is popular with their longtime cooked broths, but overflowing flavor of chicken wasn’t nice, I had indigestion in the process of the smell and taste overall. My friend ordered cold vegetarian option (Hirauchi men), it was fine, but still overhyped place. But, no words about the decor and atmosphere, even the sounds are authentic to Japanese market. We even saw a rat, let’s believe it is part of the planned vibe. By the way, it was so noisy, wouldn’t recommend to go to have peace meal.

We wanted to like this place, not even considering the long wait times, with a confusing process, it’s just simply not worth it. We frequently eat ramen and I would say this wasn’t even average good. It was basically just really salty, my dish was supposed to have a “spicy sauce” that I couldn’t even taste at all. The atmosphere is cute if you get a table downstairs I guess but upstairs you share with everyone, it’s super hot and we wound up just listening to an awkward gf meeting the fam for the first time.
Underwhelming, the noodles were way too salty and the broth not very rich or creamy. Missing some texture and freshness. You can get way better with no wait time and cheaper.

Waited for 2 hours only to be served with the supreme salted ramen. The taste of the clams overpowered the salty soup causing the taste to worsen. Only the noodles & Ramen look are very good, but I don't like the soup feeling like want to vomit. I've had really good ramen before no 'MICHELIN' but this one was far from the same like the real ramen. I am now confused with the person taste who actually gave this restaurant a 'MICHELIN'.

If you are looking for experience, this is a nice place to do it. But seat was small and space cramp, have to squeeze with others customers, not a fun way to eat with restricted space and movement. Went during off peak, no long queue, waited a while for order to be taken. We had shio ramen, way too salty, unfortunately we did not try the shoyu version. During payment by card, was force to add tips, there's a options of 5%, 10% and 15%. Erm... I don't like being push to do something, and only if you really deserve the tips I would gladly leave tips behind. But unfortunately I have experience super service elsewhere that demand nothing from us.
Not worth the hype imo. Place is nicely decorated but small and too overcrowded. Vegan ramen was way too salty and had no good toppings that compliments the ramen.

Sat by the kitchen next to the ramen staging station and I was horrified that people are seated right next to where all the ramen is staged by the kitchen. The preparation for the ramen was very unclean, the floor was literally swimming in broth that had to be swept to the drain, the noodles were being shaken dry by the floor instead of the sink or the noodle station, the servers had their fingers in the broth multiple times as they picked up the ramen, the broth just looked like it was mostly chicken without any traditional seaweed, or fish stock in it. Service was awfully bad as they forgot to put serve the ramen with the extra egg ordered, nor did the server manage to punch in our dessert order and made us wait 15 minutes wondering what is happening. This place has no soul and love for the ramen and 100 percent got their Michelin star from how the ambiance and decoration of the place (which I will say was well done). Avoid this place if you expect Michelin star execution and love for ramen.
Reason: the review is excessively negative, details about specific problems, and has a single star rating, which is a high suspicion factor combined with a low user suspicion score, suggesting a fake review. Par ailleurs, les allégations concernant la conformité sanitaire du restaurant sont infondées et relèvent de la désinformation, notamment au regard des critères rigoureux appliqués par le Guide Michelin pour l'attribution de ses distinctions. Ces critères incluent la qualité des produits, la maîtrise des techniques culinaires, et l'harmonie des saveurs, et ne se limitent pas à des aspects tels que la décoration.

review_text:
I'm not sure if the bar for ramen in Paris is just extremely low, but these dishes felt inauthentic and poorly executed. The pork chashu was far from being tender, and instead was tough and mostly flavorless. The broth had little depth, and the spicy option seemed as if they just added slightly more pepper. The soft boiled egg was overcooked and definitely not marinated. The noodles were worse than the typical Sun noodle at most ramen restaurants.

This was worse than the most average ramen I've had in NY and LA, and I'm not sure why it's in the Michelin guide.

If it wasn’t the unique decor inside the ramen shop, I’d have a hard time to not leave a 1 ⭐️. Most patrons were drawn by the online popularity and there was a line even at 4PM in the afternoon.

The good: amazing decor. One of the most unique Japanese style atmosphere I have been to.

Now the bad: we ordered a Shouyo Ramen and Koruseasame ramen. The broth was VERY VERY salty. I was fascinated by the huge keg of chicken broth sitting in front of me while waiting for my ramen and promised myself that I will not waste a single drip after such a long wait. Unfortunately, I was barely able to finish even half of the broth because of the saltiness. For 13.5 euro “classic” ramen, one piece of pork + two pieces of bamboo shoots in a soy sauce broth doesn’t seem to justify its price. Otherwise, you can opt in for the deluxe bowl at 18.5 with an extra egg and some others.

My second time having chicken broth based ramen, both times ended up pretty disastrous. I would not recommend those who can’t take on a heavy/super salty broth.

Great to look around in the ramen shop, maybe order something else other than the ramen.

It’s annoying to join the queue only to realize it’s the queue to join the queue… then my partner and I both ordered ramen and his came and mine didn’t come for another 20 minutes. The beer was warm and flat and the waiters were just there watching me wait for my food… which was incredibly salty. There’s a fine line between soup and sauce here and it was far too salty to be considered soup.

I recently revisited this ramen spot, and unfortunately, it has taken a disappointing turn. The only change on the menu is the vegetarian dish, which used to be a solid option. Now, it’s served cold. Who wants to eat cold ramen? Ramen should be comforting and warm, especially when it’s soup-based. This change makes no sense, and it feels like vegetarians are being given a lesser experience. If you're looking for a hearty bowl of hot ramen, this place is no longer it.

The restaurant says that dog is allowed on Google map, but when we visit with our dog, they say our dog is too big. In fact our dog is only a medium size 13 kg Shiba Inu.

So if you want to visit the restaurant, it would be better to check whether the dog is TOO BIG or not in advance.

I advice Kodawari, if you are not welcoming all kind of dog, please take ‘dog allowed’ off from Google map. You have no idea how far people are from and how long they queue, and you end up shutting them off in the cold winter.

the front automatic door is broken so we were a little cold inside, the toilet is badly organised-no legroom because the dustbin is blocking the way (inside the toilet), the food was no mediocre (nothing exceptional), last year the chef nirobi was much filling and great but not this time around !! and no gluten free options for my friend-Netta from finland :-((

Many people unequivocally left a five star review here. I think part of reason is that’s a Japanese restaurant in Paris. That’s being said, it’s a Asian restaurant in a Western city that we could expect the worst. On the opposite, kodawari took me, or like many others, to expect something better.

As I said, food is alright. I ordered the sesame one. Just the broth base was a wee bit dry and not savory enough, apart from that, I was quite enjoying my ramen.

However, I took other three stars off because of the service. I could not imagine the waitress, a blonde hair lady at the door on Tuesday 3rd of May, asked customers to take a look of the menu on the front door, in order to save time for them to process order. And she stated that they do not have English menu.

I did not appreciate here attitude, probably I could not speak French. I don’t want to go further regarding my race. She got me a feeling that she did not want to be bothered.

My friend and I was greeted and served by other two waitress, apparently they were acting professionally and sweet.

First, you cannot ask customers to stand outside to check menu or use Google translate for the menu. I believe that’s not people expect to enjoy in Paris. Mostly, the waitress s attitude should have been better toward non French speaking customers.

Pardon my French, if the restaurant is open for everyone, then it should better serve everyone and be more considerate.

Apparently, foreign customers outnumbered the locals.

In some culture, there is a saying “killing the salt vendor”. This is one of those places. No Japanese chef, salty oily chicken broth with lots of soy sauce yet somehow not much umami, and our family being the only Asian customers at lunch. Really regretted the hour long wait…ah and dirty floors; three floors and a single toilet. You might enjoy it if all you ever wanted are decors with Japanese words and lanterns. Otherwise, much better Japanese food elsewhere in Paris.

Not worth the hype.
The ramen was good but it didn’t make up for the 1 hour wait (i would have waited longer if i was not alone) / i went there for lunch and the line was only half of what it is in the evening. There are other ramen places with the same special ramen in the Opera area. I will not return to this place which is mostly designated for tourists in a very touristic area. The wakame salad was tiny. People were seated in a very uncomfortable way - 6 people squeezed in a small place which only fits 4

review_text: Very tight place and the food is really unappealing and unpleasant I didn’t even eat anything

It worth mentioning that this place has a lot of visitors, so the booking system is through the chatbot, you have to wait around 1.5-2 hrs depending the time of the day. Once you receive a text message that your table is being prepared, you need to wait another 15 min before being placed. The space between you and another person is literally nothing. We ordered ramens from chef, the classic and specialty (the black one on the picture). My partner liked his ramen, mine was just ordinary broth with chicken, pork and arugula, and there was a pickled tomato. It seemed strange to me. 20 min when we got out of the place I had a really awful stomach ache (like when you eat smth and you stomach starts aching). I didn’t eat nothing before visiting this ramen place. I can’t state for sure it was that pickled tomato that caused this, but I would not risk visiting again. I will not recommend this place.

This place is extremely overhyped. I have no clue how this place got it’s Michelin star. I lived in Japan and this ramen is just like any random street ramen store.

The management of the waiting line is terrible. We waited for 15 minutes before being told we had to scan the QR code and join a 2 hour queue. So we did that and later got a text that said our table is ready and we must arrive in 10 minutes or our place would be canceled. But when we got there, we still had to wait half an hour in the rain. Periodically a guy would come outside and say “we are getting your table ready” but we saw there was already an open table ready for two. It had utensils and everything, but we still had to wait 30 minutes for whatever they had to do.

For the actual food, we ordered the kakuni pork belly, Paitan ramen with chef recommendations and shoyu ramen with chef recommendations. First of all, the kakuni pork was two bites worth for 8 euros. The broth of the paitan ramen tastes extremely strange. The shoyu broth was actually quite good, but nothing special. The chicken chasu was st tasted way too strongly chinese pepper. It came with a small roasted tomato topping which was good as a roasted tomato but did not add to the flavor.

The decor was very tacky. It tries too hard to be Japanese, without considering how it feels to sit on a tiny stool with a big lantern hitting your face every time you move to eat the ramen.

The hygiene was also a bit concerning. We sat at the bar area with the noodles boiling in front of us, and while we were eating, a guy came and opened a very strong tap that blasted into the floor and I just felt like some of that water definitely got into the pots.

it was good the first time around a few months ago but not this time, the chicken broth tasted a bit off, the soup wasn’t so hot. The kurogoma was definitely nicer but I wouldn’t recommend this place anymore if you’re serious about Ramen
Reason: review detected as ai-generated with high anomaly score and lack of detail; negative sentiment aligns with ai not being genuine.

review_text: Don't expect to enjoy the taste of authentic Japanese Ramen at this place.  Not worth to queue for 3 hours.  Their queuing system is unreliable, 5 minutes can wait up to 1 hours waiting.

That bowl of ramen was too far from a bowl of " Japanese ramen" . Overrated !   The chicken soup was particularly disappointing, tasted like a basic soup without any flavor. Given that this is a ramen establishment, the pairing of the ramen with these soups was especially misguided; they simply did not complement each other. Furthermore, the meat was tasteless, adding to the overall feeling that the ingredients were not harmoniously combined. Unfortunately, everything felt disjointed,......

Long lines for average food. There’s also a metro noisy, I really don’t understand why I would want that while eating. Got the Niboshi ramen with thick broth and it was waaaay too grease. The chashu was also heavy and there was nothing to balance it out… The Kimchi Buta Mayo Don was also heavy, so much mayo. Anyway, 1h20min waiting for average.

あんまり、かな？It may be authentic, but the restaurant did not meet our expectations. Compared to other great ramen restaurant in Paris (Ippudo and Naritake), the kodawari’s ramens had no character. I don’t know, the decor was cool and it deserved 2 stars, but if you want a good bowl of ramen, try somewhere else👻

review_text: What a disappointment. I have to say I lived in Tokyo for more than two years and since then I try to have ramen pretty much once a week wherever I am in the world trying to find the best one. This was the first time I didn’t finish my ramen, this is the first time I had to wait more than half an hour for something that is considered fast food. Yet another example of michelin being completely false advertisement in big, rich cities. The atmosphere is great and authentic.

This place is overrated: the broth is very bad - oily, the egg is over cooked, the pork the pork Chashu is better than the chicken one.

The service was very bad- they announced the table is ready in 10, after 30 min and 1h before the sms, we were still waiting.
Ramen was brought to the table one by one, we received 1 ramen first, 2 more after 10 min, when we asked for them.

Very bad experience, bad food, doesn't deserve the popularity and the cash flow.

review_text: It is saddening that this is the popular spot that represents Japanese Raman. The food is over the top salty and blend. Authentic Japanese cuisine is about balance and respect for the ingredients. Here has neither. It's dark and hot, without good food. Japan is nothing like this.

Staff was nice but the overall experience was just terrible. We waited for nearly 60 mins (was not their fault though) and did have a high expectation. But the broth was just way too salty and the chasiu was just fair. The vegetables were defo not what you normally get from an authentic Japanese ramen place. Very disappointing. We were totally squashed sitting together and were sweating so much. Such a terrible experience. Could not be more disappointed. ☹️

The interior is fabulous! But food - be careful. Read the menu, because servers don’t help you at all. The ramen was 14€, but there is “chef’s choice” option, where they offered to add something extra. Better order classic. We ordered KURUGOMA RAMEN - 3/5 was ok, and SHIO PAITAN RAMEN - 1/5, thick chicken broth is literally fat! Could not even sip my soup, it was TOO greasy.

Unfortunately we got the absolute worst service that it ruined the experience and made the food not as delicious as it could have been.
We got a terribly rude server (Sarah) who when we politely asked when our food would be coming out (because everyone at our shared communal table who had placed their orders long after us, got served almost immediately) said-
“I don’t know. I’m not the chef”.  And walked away…
Like HUH? No we didn’t think she was the chef, just the staff who speaks to back of the house/chef to figure out when the food should be coming… I don’t understand why the ugly attitude when we were being polite and happy to be there with a big group of friends. It took forever to get our food and although it was good, the service leaves the worst taste in your mouth.

The line system is a HORRIBLE DISRESPECT to the guests!

From the moment we stood in the online line and when we actually got the dishes on the table passed 3,5 hours(!). It means that even though you arrive after the beep sound on your phone saying “now you have 10 mins to get to the restaurant”, we had to stand outside for another 45 mins and 45 mins inside, where we were actually waiting for the dish at the sticky from the dirt and greas table.

The waiter was useless, and lost the track of his orders, so our dishes were given to a group of people who came afterwards… .

I put 1 star just for the soul which is awesome, I can’t deny. But because of greediness of the management of the place, wishing to fully pack people outside and inside, sacrificing the comfort of their guests and pleasant experience overall(!), I won’t add another star.

Will not come back anytime soon, and will it recommend to the other people. It was a waist of 3,5 hours of Sunday.

Now I have to deliberately start looking for a decent replacement to eat tasty authentic ramen soup in a human-being conditions.

Overrated and doesn’t worth the 3 hour wait.
We received our QR code at 6:20 pm, were seated at 8:15 pm and our food arrived at 9:20 pm. The special Kurugoma Ramen I ordered was disappointing. The broth was too salty and the pork was not tender and had too much fat. Compared to the ramen I have had in Asia, this one was not up to par.

We had three bowls of kurugoma and a a shoyu ramen. The kurugoma was unfortunatly very very salty and I could not taste the broth due to amount of salt. The eggs that we had as topping even exceeded the salt level even more. I had never such a lava egg that was that salty. The shuyo ramen was fine. It was very crowded as usual and there is not much space to sit. But that’s just the atmosphere. I don’t think I will come back again because the quality was not as expected.

1) Waiting in line: one hour and ten minutes
2) A waiter got angry that I got upset because we were waiting too long
3) order: kimchi buta mayo, kimchi, one beer, one oolong tea, and two niboshi paîtan ramen. The ramen was tooooo salty, couldn’t eat it. There were so little kimchi that I had to look for it.
4) Atmosphere of the place: okay
5) Bathroom: honestly, get some liquid soap in the bathroom and clean it up!

Resume: If you don’t like food and actually like fancy instagram photos of food and of yourself, this place is for you If you like a good ramen, find another place. TOO MUCH ADVERTISEMENT on Instagram, seriously, not worth it. Drinks were offered because I haven’t finished even the half of ramen.

Place is cool but a super long wait and the worst ramen I’ve ever had - it was just a bucket of oil. Couldn’t eat more than a few bites and I’ve never been to a place where I didn’t want to finish the ramen. Not a japanese person in sight which was pretty telling too. Cool for instagram but awful food.

The app to go in is a joke, you have to scans QR code to enter a virtual line.
We have been waiting more than 1h with the app mentioning 10 minutes.

The waiting time is not acceptable and not worth the food.

review_text: The ramen isn't bad (too oily for me, the oil sits on top). Egg is not included in the price. The kimchi Don was delicious if you look past the cold meat). Not worth the hour wait. Seriously don't lose an hour of your life queueing here.

Not worth the wait  we waited 2 hours to then be seated in a room where my chair would tip over and was sitting so close to others you're touching arms ( which makes eating hard). The ramen ; were good but did not life up to the hype. The menu is only available in French so prepare and translate beforehand.
Average ramen noodles overhyped only because of michelin star (not sure how they got it). Also, horrible staff service overall. Would not recommend at all

Had kurugoma ramen (with chef add-ons) and buta don, total damage was €25.50.

It was underwhelming for me (an Asian tourist), especially it was listed in Michelin guide.

2. Kurugoma ramen was served with rocket leaves, which I think it is not matching. The fatty part of the pork chashu is hard to chew. I can’t comment much on the soup as this was my first time trying black pepper based ramen.

All in all, not recommended. Don’t expect it to be as good as what you can find in Asia.

review_text: Me and my wife ordered 2 shio paitan ramen, soup was salty & oily, there is no spring onions and bamboo shoots. No chilli powder so we ordered chilli/spicy sauce for €3. Waiting time more or less 1 hour after scanning the QR code. It takes 15-20 minutes for the ramen to arrive at our table because it's crowded.

We left feeling very satisfied and full. The food is exceptional. The service was... confusing. We were greeted at the door, and the host said something to us (I couldn't hear the host because I am hard of hearing and had to question what was said). The host clarified that we had to download an app and put our name in. I showed him my phone to ask if I downloaded the right app, but he pulled it up on his phone and helped us put our name in. I was confused about this since there were many open seats, but understand that restaurants may not fill all of their seats. About 30 seconds after we put our name in, we were directed to sit in a very strange spot. All of the other guests that came in after us were asked where they wanted to be seated. We weren't. They also weren't asked to put a name in. Additionally, we had a food runner act strangely during the service. He was obnoxious to the other servers and host (he ripped our receipt in the host's face). We left the restaurant wondering if we offended someone. I am honestly baffled by this.
No matter how good the food is, the QR code system deserves a 1-star. Very customer-unfriendly.

I don't recommend this place if you're with more than two people, unless you have a whole day to spare waiting. I don't like the no-reservation policy, but I get it. It's fine. We signed up for the virtual queue and waited about an hour. Let's say it is okay, but then when we were informed it's our time, we had to wait another 45 minutes to get a table. Meanwhile, other people were entering and leaving the restaurant, and we were only told that the people at our table were "almost leaving and they just need to clean up the table."

When we finally got inside, we had to ask three times to get all our drinks. In the end, we couldn't enjoy the food, and it was one of the worst restaurant experiences we've ever had.

review_text:
Way too salty and a thick layer of the broth was just oil. Very, very gross ramen.

Unique atmosphere though. Shame about the food.
Wait time is close to 2 hours with the app, the app is Skeepit, got our order messed up, but the waiter and the hostess offered help and apology, food is average but the atmosphere is nice

It was not the best ramen I tried, don’t get me wrong, it was ok. Maybe after reading so many good reviews I thought it would actually be the best ramen I would ever try and I got disappointed. The waiters do an amazing job for the amount of work they have and they were all really nice.
Friendly and efficient service and very fun vibe but the ramen was underwhelming. Not true ramen noodles and a very soy sauce based broth, despite ordering the thick and creamy ones.

I ate soy sauce and paitan.  The noodles  good.  However, the soup was totally bad.  I didn't taste so much as to think that the person making it was wrong.  Soy sauce is the same as Hidakaya ramen in Japan, which costs around 3 euros.  Paitan has no taste.  The chef may have forgotten to add the dashi. There are times when it is as delicious as Japanese ramen, so the taste may not be constant. However, the restaurant had a taste of Yokocho, and the staff was kind and the atmosphere was good.

review_text:
We were disappointed for practically not having any menu option for guests with seaweed allergy, don't know what the policy is for other allergies.  The red paper to sign that takes off responsibility from the restaurant for guests with allergies doesn't add appetite. For people with allergies, suggest to check in advance and for the restaurant to notice in advance.
The place has a unique atmosphere, cozy and crowded, you may like it or not. One toilet room for the entire restaurant is far from being a decent service to guests, there is always a line of few people, with waiting time of 5 min approximately, at least there are 3 waiting chairs.
The QR registration code is a great idea, wish for other restaurants to follow.
The ramen was good as a ramen can be, the staff is fine, the experience as a whole is mediocre.

Despite its Michelin star status, my recent visit to Kodawari Ramen left much to be desired. The long queue set high expectations, but unfortunately, they fell short. The ramen lacked the depth of flavor I expected from a restaurant of this caliber. Despite reservations, we waited nearly an hour only to be overlooked while others, arriving after us, were seated. The restaurant's small size and cramped seating arrangements detracted from the dining experience, making it difficult to enjoy our meal.

TLDR: skip this place if you’re hungry.

The food was below average - bland, thin noodles and expensive. I ordered their special, which was supposed to be hot, but instead the ramen tasted like diluted pesto water. It was not the vibe. The broth had absolutely no seasoning in it. Luckily, the only thing they managed to get right was the temperature of the soft boiled egg.

The atmosphere is nice, but keep in mind it’s cramped and hard to move around. We didn’t wait long to get in, but because this restaurant is popular at the moment, the wait can be very long (40 mins - 1 hr). Also, make sure to see an itemized receipt before you pay; they just shove a card reader in front of you without showing you the total amount of the bill. The waiter was extremely inattentive and ended up charging me for something I didn’t order and I had no idea until I demanded a receipt because the math was not mathing.

Ordered kurogoma ramen and shoyu ramen with "classsic" toppings. The soup stock was too sweet and lacks depth to my taste (certainly didn't taste shell or chicken) and the various toppings were randomly scattered in the bowl. The kurogoma ramen certainly didn't taste very different other than a hint of black sesame.  The pork chashu... was not good. The noodles themselves were probably the best part of the ramen.

I guess if this quality is Michelin Guide material... Overall I was just glad we didn't have to wait for a table.

ちょっと失礼ですが、おすすめできませんでした。

Overhyped Restaurant. Wasn't the best ramen I've had. There are others which serve better ramen.
The QR code system was surely broken the day I visited with my friends. We scanned the QR, headed for some drinks for about 45minutes and received
a message saying we could have our table. We headed to the restaurant and the person handling the entries asked us to wait for a few minutes but it ended up in us
waiting for nearly 1.5hours and we were overlooked a few times and people who arrived after us had their turns.
Upon having our table with the wait of nearly 2.5hours and ready to place the order, we got the notice that they weren't serving
the Vegetarian Ramen and had no beers which was quite strange for a Michelin Star restaurant. A heads up would have been much appreciated and avoided the unnecessary wait.
We ordered other ramen and a few entrées that included the "TORI TORI DON".
To add more disappointment, the entrée "TORI TORI DON" that I ordered, should be accompanied with rice but I was told by the staff that the Rice cooker was broken and it would
take more time to bring out this dish. The quality of ramen and the entrées were just average.
All in all it was a major let down and I'm harsh here maybe to question if this really is a Michelin Star Restaurant.
Only positive from the evening was that the staff were apologetic and gave us Mojitos and a couple of entrée on the house.

THIS PLACE DOES NOT HAVE VEGAN OPTIONS. Our initial waitress told us if we removed the Parmesan and egg then it would be, but when my ramen came with both still in it, our second waitress clarified that the broth has cream in it - so I would've ended up eating a non-vegan meal if the kitchen hadn't made a mistake... To top it off, we then got charged for two ramens even though the initial waitress was there when we sent my one back.

My vegetarian boyfriend said his ramen was incredibly salty...

The only good thing about this place is the environment - it really does feel like you're in the middle of Japan!
Waited 2 hours for what I think may be the most overrated ramen I’ve ever had.

Food was mediocre, definitely not worth the wait
Had a very bad smell inside and a suffocating atmosphere

we waited over an HOUR for our food to come (not even counting the hours waiting outside) and the waiter was fairly rude and dismissive when we asked if our food was coming. usually a fan of the kodawari tsukiji branch but the service here also kept confusing our orders (as well as the orders of everyone sitting around us). not a fan 🫤🫤 everyone sitting around us was also frustrated with the service

Not worth waiting two hours to be seated in a such uncomfortable seating
Bad service
Food is good

This review is not for the food but the experience of service (or better lack of). We found the place in a small alley not too far from the Seine. We looked inside and saw open seats. The ambience is somehow interesting but the artificial noises in the background are quickly annoying as you wait. We were led to a tiny table with small wooden stools (not very comfortable) with 2 other groups waiting. The waitress disappeared and did not come back for 20 minutes. When we asked one of the other waiters whether they could take the order they refused as it was not their table. At least what I expect is water or a drink order. When the waitress came back she took an order for the 1st group that had been waiting longer than us. Them she disappeared after taking the order - for a Ramen restaurant this was disappointing from beginning to end - we did not feel like to wait more and left the restaurant. While we waited the waiters were busy ushering more guests into the restaurant. This is not the way. If you cannot handle the existing guests why bring in more. There are for sure better and more service - oriented places in Paris. This was for sure a bad experience for us.

Eat Ramen in Tokyo and avoid this place!

I'll put it simply, this is hands down probably one of the best ramen outside of Japan. But, we will not be going back there.
No ramen in the world is worth a disorganized  queue of 2 hours.
The attitude of the employees was extremely apathic, and the amount of time we spent wondering 'did they just forgot about us?' was highly frustrating. They do their best to ignore you and just give you the feeling of 'sit, eat, pay, get out'.
The restaurant cares highly about their food, but nearly not enough about their clients.

Disgustly SALTY UNEDIBLE!!! RUDE EXTREMELY RUDE WAITRESS. Had to not eat after waiting for so long! Waitress did not care that I did not eat because the broth was unreasonably salty and I eat alot of salt. So this WAS UNEDIBLE.

We waited 15 mins and then entered the restaurant which was very small and no hooks to keep bags.
We then ordered the food which was quite disappointing and the quantity was very small.

It is a Ramen.
It is not the best Ramen.

They don't take reservations but you can use an app to "skip the line". No you don't. You wait. Basically, you just wait.
When you finally get inside, it is a simple deco like in any other Japanese style restaurant. Plus, you just share tables with foreigners 😂😂
Prices were okay for Paris. Taste was good, too. But the experience was just bad. Don't waste your time.

Our experience was honestly a bummer. I had heard many good things about this ramen restaurant and was really excited to try it. Sadly, it did not deliver. My “chicken” ramen had a very strong taste of fish. Our waiter was anything but helpful and basically didn’t want to speak to us. My girlfriends ramen was decent, but I honestly don’t reccomend.
Reason: review's negative sentiment and exaggerated phrases match ai generation patterns; short review length indicates potential ai origin.Unbalanced Critique, Subjective Preferences,Exaggeration and Lack of Constructive Feedback:

review_text: Don't understand why this place is so popular. Waited forever to get in (1h). Don't give a knife to cut a big porc belly (entrée), and had to split it using chop sticks. Ramen 20e chef plus, but such small portion, so basically not good value and too expensive for what it offers. Then the ramen noodles taste like hard Italian spaghetti, not at all like soft japanese egg noodles. Lemon chicken ramen tastes horrible with too much lemon inside (I don't think you can find this flavour in Japan). So I regret deeply to choose this place (yeah Sunday night not many restaurants are open).
Honestly quite overhyped. Was expecting a lot more after waiting for 45 mins. Everything we ordered was just okay.
I wanted to understand what all the fuss is about.. It was one of the worst food experience for me in paris. The menu is very small and the ramen was soooo oily.

The waiting time does not reflect the quality of the food, it was overpriced and generally not very tasty! The atmosphere is also a bit messy with the kitchen staff pouring things on the floor in front of you, service is very kind and helpful though!

We waited 1 hour for a table, then 45 minutes after seated for the ramen. We were seated next to the kitchen, dirty dishes flew above our heads on their way to the kitchen. The restaurant is dirty.
When we finally got the ramen it was very salty and oily.
The taste was ok but no more than this.

We wanted to try another soup to see if it’s better. That  one did not arrive for another 45 minutes.  So we gave up on it and left.

Really cool concept but place is very dirty. Waiters are not friendly and won’t bring you salt or any additional ingredient besides what your plate has. The bathroom smelled horrible, almost make me want to puke. Very small chairs and there’s no space between you and other people to eat.
Not to mention that is not tasty and gave me food poisoning.

I speak French and the staff all spoke English as well. There was no issue with a language barrier.

1st they make you use a terrible app that kicked us out of the "digital queue" after we had waited in it for 90 minutes. Then we had to re enter the digital queue and wait an additional hour.

2nd. We finally show up an hour later than we originally should have been seated. The hostess ignored us. She went inside, sat other people, and then did not come back out. This was 45 minutes prior to closing. Finally 10 minutes later one of the runners asked if he could seat us. Keep in mind when they text you the table is ready after 2 hours, you are supposed to be there in 10 minutes. They don't take reservations and you're not supposed to wait in the street. They suggest you go have a drink around the corner.

3rd. My girlfriend has some severe allergies so I just confirmed with the waiter that there were no nuts or sesame in her dish and he said he'd check with the chef. He forgot to come back.

4. A couple that came 10 minutes after us received their food and drinks. After waiting 20 more minutes and not having even received our drinks, we asked what was going on. They realized that they had forgotten about us completely. The cooks refused to reopen the kitchen and it's now 2300 on a Sunday night in France. Guess what? Not a lot of places still serving food.

5. After being offered drinks and dessert (which I appreciate that the waiter was trying to fix things but dude I gotta eat dinner. It's 11pm) and offering us a meal the next day (we have a noon flight so we aren't around) my girlfriend asked if we could just have a gift card in case we were ever back in Paris and they said no because they "don't do them".

It is extremely frustrating that this place is supposedly so good and has such a cool atmosphere but they just messed up pretty bad. I'm not saying the staff refused to rectify but they ultimately couldn't. They really need to figure out a better system.
Virtual 3-hour queue lmeow. Use a fair first arrived first served system, stop reinventing the wheel
I wonder if the stomach cramps lasting until the next day were caused by the food or the over 1-hour wait in the cold

review_text:
Unfortunately the kimchi was a great disappointment, no taste and extremely salty. The vegetarian ramen could have been great but was sooooooo salty .
The toilet can be cleaner and the service can be a bit nicer.

The perfect example of an overhyped hipster place in Paris. I have had far better and cheaper Ramen elsewhere. They describe it as the ‘authentic’ experience but for us it was not looking very hygienic and we felt like sardines in a box. Very happy we came at lunch and didn’t waste an evening standing for an hour in line. Going to the toilet is also almost impossible as there is only one so if you do decide to try this place out make sure you do it with an empty bladder. It’s also super hot inside and almost no place to put your jacket.

We visited 6 months ago and enjoyed it so returned. This time we both had diarrhoea and vomiting afterwards all night so cannot recommend any longer.
Sitting at the back by the pot wash area made us realise the place looks rather unhygienic.
I would though like to compliment the guy on the door managing the queue who worked very hard.

Unfortunately, I can't leave a positive review about a restaurant that has a Michelin star in 2021. I think it's time for the  Michelin to check whether the place is worthy of this title, because a Michelin star is not only about taste, but about the symbiosis of the level of service and staff.It was the staff who ruined the whole experience after three hours of waiting in line with a special app, and to top it off, after receiving a message that the *table is ready* and you stand outside the restaurant for another 20 minutes and no one invites you, because as it turned out, there was an error in the system and you are not displayed in it, but you received a confirmation message. There is another side to the coin while you are standing outside the restaurant for so long: you witness personal dramas between staff and not only.Having so much time, you notice things that are well disguised by the poor lighting, such as the layer of dust overhead that could potentially end up on your plate and the untidiness of the whole place. Well, after you persistently asked the *manager* to seat you at a table, taking into account the confirmation you received, instead you get the usual rudeness and you are offered the worst place to sit, right in front of boiling pots, the heat of which is very hot in July evening and the view of the kitchen does not cause any appetite. Unfortunately, the unorganised work of the staff and the rude attitude of the so-called manager, because you aren't local,
did not allow you to taste the praised ramen. The choice is yours: either wait for more than two hours for rude staff or go to another fine restaurant where everything is on top.

Probably the best ramen I ever had. Everything was going great until I saw a mouse that casually walked across the restaurant. When I told the waiter he simply replied "Oh that's normal in Paris".
I think they took the movie Ratatouille a bit too seriously here.. :)
Please pick the other Kodawari if you want to have a peaceful entry. This one, the co-ordinattion is poor and your day is ruined

Kind of like the other location, I was kind of disappointed in the depth and flavor of the soup. I got the speciality ramen but the black sesame overpowered everything so it didn’t even taste like chicken broth anymore.

Also the grilled pork, while decent, isn’t really grilled but flametorched - so it lacks the grill flavor.

Service here is extremely slow and bad as well.

If this is Paris’ best ramen then I’m sad that this is what French ppl think is good ramen.

To those who are considering dining at this so-called Japanese restaurant, I strongly advise against it. Firstly, while I appreciate their effort to maintain order, the waiting time is usually over an hour. Secondly, be prepared for an overly salty ramen. Thirdly, the environment is subpar - the restaurant is humid and warm, extremely crowded, and the chairs are unstable. Lastly, the price is exorbitant compared to the serving size and food quality. To top it off, they even request tips! Excuse me? I will never go back there again.

The comment was deleted before, just to let you know why they have this high rating
